title: Last injurious exposure rule
text: In <a href="law">law</a>, the last injurious exposure rule is the principle that when an <a href="occupational%20disease">occupational disease</a> was caused by a succession of jobs, or could have been caused by any one of a succession of jobs, the most recent employer with the <a href="risk">risk</a> exposure is <a href="liable">liable</a>.
